hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Convergence Failure in Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: In a STRESS regime, when multiple negative catalysts align (e.g., price drop + liquidations + macro fear), but BTC fails to make a new lower low within 12 hours, it signals maximum pessimism and sets up for a violent, short-covering rally of 4-6% as stacked catalysts fail to drive further downside.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress, markets price in worst-case scenarios quickly. Multiple concurrent negative catalysts represent peak fear. Failure to break lower indicates selling exhaustion. Increasing OI suggests shorts are adding, creating fuel for a squeeze if price moves up.
entry_conditions: ≥2 negative catalysts present within 6h (price drop >4%, large liquidations, negative news spike)
BTC consolidates in a tight range (<1.5%) for 12 hours after catalysts, without making a new 12h low
Open Interest in futures increases during consolidation (indicating short buildup)
Spot exchange reserves remain flat or decrease

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC breaks below the 12h consolidation range low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If consolidation is merely a pause before continuation downward on increasing volume, indicating sustained selling pressure.
